page.title: 11TRANSPORT IN TILSTON
page.content: As Tilston is a rural village most of the villagers have to rely on their {own transport}for gettimg about. Most families have a car. There is also a {public transport bus}that takes people to the neighbouring towns of{Chester, {Wrexham, Whitchurch and Malpas. School-children either come by car or bike to Tilston school. Older children have a special school bus to go to the Bishop Heber High School. Adults who are employed, travel to work by car. A bus shelter is going to be built near the Fox and Hounds. Little traffic goes through the village. At certain times of the year the village is active with farmers using their tractors. Many children and locals use bikes for going around the village. A helicopter often lands near the village and we are on a flight path for Manchester airport.
